segment.source: Application Virtualization Properties General Tab
segment.target: Application Virtualization Properties General Tab

segment.source: Application Virtualization Properties General Tab
segment.target: Application Virtualization Properties General Tab

segment.source: Application Virtualization Properties: General Tab
segment.target: Application Virtualization Properties: General Tab

segment.source: Use the General tab of the Application Virtualization Properties dialog box to modify log settings and data locations.
segment.target: Use the General tab of the Application Virtualization Properties dialog box to modify log settings and data locations.

segment.source: This tab contains the following elements.
segment.target: This tab contains the following elements.

segment.source: Log Level
segment.target: Log Level

segment.source: Select the level from the drop-down list.
segment.target: Select the level from the drop-down list.

segment.source: The default level is Information.
segment.target: The default level is Information.

segment.source: Reset Log
segment.target: Reset Log

segment.source: Click this button to back up the current log file and immediately start a new log file.
segment.target: Click this button to back up the current log file and immediately start a new log file.

segment.source: Location
segment.target: Location

segment.source: Enter or browse to the location where you want to save the log file sftlog.txt.
segment.target: Enter or browse to the location where you want to save the log file sftlog.txt.

segment.source: The default locations are as follows:
segment.target: The default locations are as follows:

segment.source: For Windows XP, Windows Server 2003—C:Documents and SettingsAll UsersApplication DataMicrosoftApplication Virtualization Client
segment.target: For Windows XP, Windows Server 2003—C:Documents and SettingsAll UsersApplication DataMicrosoftApplication Virtualization Client

segment.source: For Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008—C:ProgramDataMicrosoftApplication Virtualization Client
segment.target: For Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008—C:ProgramDataMicrosoftApplication Virtualization Client

segment.source: System Log Level
segment.target: System Log Level

segment.source: Select the level from the drop-down list.
segment.target: Select the level from the drop-down list.

segment.source: The default level is Warning.
segment.target: The default level is Warning.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The System Log Level setting controls the level of messages sent to the system event log.
segment.target: The System Log Level setting controls the level of messages sent to the system event log.

segment.source: The logged messages are identical to the messages that get logged to the client event log, but they are stored in a different location that does not have the space limitations of the client event log.
segment.target: The logged messages are identical to the messages that get logged to the client event log, but they are stored in a different location that does not have the space limitations of the client event log.

segment.source: Because the system event log does not have space limitations, it is ideally suited for situations where verbose logging is necessary.
segment.target: Because the system event log does not have space limitations, it is ideally suited for situations where verbose logging is necessary.

segment.source: Global Data Directory
segment.target: Global Data Directory

segment.source: Enter or browse to the location of the directory of the log file.
segment.target: Enter or browse to the location of the directory of the log file.

segment.source: The default locations are as follows:
segment.target: The default locations are as follows:

segment.source: For Windows XP, Windows Server 2003—C:Documents and SettingsAll UsersApplication DataMicrosoftApplication Virtualization Client
segment.target: For Windows XP, Windows Server 2003—C:Documents and SettingsAll UsersApplication DataMicrosoftApplication Virtualization Client

segment.source: For Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008—C:ProgramDataMicrosoftApplication Virtualization Client
segment.target: For Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008—C:ProgramDataMicrosoftApplication Virtualization Client

segment.source: User Data Directory
segment.target: User Data Directory

segment.source: Enter or browse to the location of the directory where user-specific data is stored.
segment.target: Enter or browse to the location of the directory where user-specific data is stored.

segment.source: The default is %APPDATA%.
segment.target: The default is %APPDATA%.

segment.source: This path must be a valid environment variable on the client computer.
segment.target: This path must be a valid environment variable on the client computer.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: Client Management Console: Application Virtualization Properties
segment.target: Client Management Console: Application Virtualization Properties
